algorithm_technique: Greedy approach comparing the current characters of both strings and appending the lexicographically larger one.
problem_summary_simple: Merge two strings to create the lexicographically largest possible string.
problem_summary_technical: Uses a greedy strategy by comparing the current characters of both strings and appending the larger one.
time_complexity: O(n * m) where n and m are lengths of word1 and word2, due to string comparisons.
key_insights: The core idea is to always pick the character that leads to a lexicographically larger string.
When characters are equal, a lookahead is needed to determine which string will yield a larger subsequent sequence.
Using deques allows for efficient O(1) removal from the front.
